text: Ugh betfair just forced me to create a new account because I logged in from outside the UK and they thought it was compromised. Now they've given me a brand new account without any betting history, lifetime commission or API access...

elements.text: Ugh betfair just forced me to create a new account because I logged in from outside the UK and they thought it was compromised. Now they've given me a brand new account without any betting history, lifetime commission or API access...

text: And without my balance either! Although that is apparently going to be transferred

text: ..you logged in from outside the UK once and they assume you dont live in the UK anymore? How does that make any sense?

text: i ve logged in from outside the UK plenty of times, no issues there. Has anyone else experienced something simular like mandelbot ?

text: No they assumed the account was compromised and closed it based on that. I have 2FA on the account and explained that it was me who logged on so no need to close the account, but they just keep repeating that the account was closed because it was compromised...

elements.text: No they assumed the account was compromised and closed it based on that. I have 2FA on the account and explained that it was me who logged on so no need to close the account, but they just keep repeating that the account was closed because it was compromised...

text: This is interesting. On the one hand I applaud them for taking prompt action, but on the other it sounds like they should have tried to contact you. I remember accidentally trying to deposit 2000 instead of 200 to betfair with a credit card. It was rejected and within 5 mins the CC company phoned me to verify that I had attempted the transaction. Seems that a similar approach would have been better.

elements.text: This is interesting. On the one hand I applaud them for taking prompt action, but on the other it sounds like they should have tried to contact you. I remember accidentally trying to deposit 2000 instead of 200 to betfair with a credit card. It was rejected and within 5 mins the CC company phoned me to verify that I had attempted the transaction. Seems that a similar approach would have been better.

text: If its not prying too deeply, is there any chance you had a very large balance and the decision was based around that?

elements.text: If its not prying too deeply, is there any chance you had a very large balance and the decision was based around that?

text: You shouldn't have had to miss out <@UQL0QDEKA> it's perfectly possible to have overlapping accounts. Regarding app keys and certs you just generate new app keys and you can keep using the same certs as they're a faff to make, just upload them to the new account. I didn't ask for funds to be transferred internally. You can get API permissioned on both accounts just ask Neil.

elements.text: You shouldn't have had to miss out

it's perfectly possible to have overlapping accounts. Regarding app keys and certs you just generate new app keys and you can keep using the same certs as they're a faff to make, just upload them to the new account. I didn't ask for funds to be transferred internally. You can get API permissioned on both accounts just ask Neil.

text: Good to know overlapping accounts is an option, switching currencies is back on the table!
